block.p: Dayle Ellen Hochman, the daughter of Marjory and Stuart Hochman of Boca Raton, Fla., is to be married this evening to James Nelson Burnes, a son of Mardi Burnes of Belvedere, Calif. Rabbi Brett S. Goldstein will perform the ceremony at the Biltmore Hotel in Coral Gables, Fla.

The bride, 27, graduated magna cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania and recently received an M.B.A degree from Columbia University. In July, she is to become an associate in the high-technology investment banking group at Goldman, Sachs in New York. Her mother is a claims representative for Associated Industries Insurance Services, in Boca Raton. Her father retired as the director of real estate for General Motors in Detroit.

Dayle Ellen Hochman, the daughter of Marjory and Stuart Hochman of Boca Raton, Fla., is to be married this evening to James Nelson Burnes, a son of Mardi Burnes of Belvedere, Calif. Rabbi Brett S. Goldstein will perform the ceremony at the Biltmore Hotel in Coral Gables, Fla.

The bride, 27, graduated magna cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania and recently received an M.B.A degree from Columbia University. In July, she is to become an associate in the high-technology investment banking group at Goldman, Sachs in New York. Her mother is a claims representative for Associated Industries Insurance Services, in Boca Raton. Her father retired as the director of real estate for General Motors in Detroit.

The bridegroom, 26, is an associate in health-care investment banking at Lehman Brothers in New York. He graduated from the University of California at Berkeley. His mother is a mortgage loan officer with the Bank of America in San Francisco.
